Files

cargo_doc2readme/
preproc.rs

1use itertools::Itertools as _;
2use log::debug;
3use std::{io, iter::Peekable};
4
5enum Attr {
6	Doc {
7		/// The indent before the doc comment
8		indent: String,
9		/// The style (e.g. `//!`) of the doc comment
10		style: String,
11		/// The indent of the comment itself
12		comment_indent: String,
13		/// The comment trimmed of any indent
14		comment: String
15	},
16	Verbatim {
17		/// An entire line of source code
18		line: String
19	}
20}
21
22pub struct Preprocessor<L>
23where
24	L: Iterator<Item = io::Result<String>>
25{
26	/// Remaining lines to read from the underlying reader
27	lines: Peekable<L>,
28	/// Buffer of processed lines ready to be read
29	buf: Vec<u8>
30}
31
32impl<R> Preprocessor<io::Lines<R>>
33where
34	R: io::BufRead
35{
36	pub fn new(read: R) -> Self {
37		Self {
38			lines: read.lines().peekable(),
39			buf: Vec::new()
40		}
41	}
42}
43
44impl<L> Preprocessor<L>
45where
46	L: Iterator<Item = io::Result<String>>
47{
48	fn fill_buf(&mut self) -> io::Result<()> {
49		let mut attrs = Vec::<Attr>::new();
50		while let Some(line) = self.lines.peek() {
51			let line = match line {
52				Ok(line) => line,
53				Err(_) => break
54			};
55			let trimmed = line.trim_start();
56			if trimmed.starts_with("//!") || trimmed.starts_with("///") {
57				let line = self.lines.next().unwrap().unwrap();
58				let mut chars = line.chars();
59				let indent = chars
60					.peeking_take_while(|ch| ch.is_whitespace())
61					.collect::<String>();
62				let style = (&mut chars).take(3).collect::<String>();
63				let comment_indent = chars
64					.peeking_take_while(|ch| ch.is_whitespace())
65					.collect::<String>();
66				let comment = chars.collect::<String>();
67				attrs.push(Attr::Doc {
68					indent,
69					style,
70					comment_indent,
71					comment
72				});
73			} else if trimmed.is_empty()
74				|| trimmed.starts_with("//")
75				|| trimmed.starts_with('#')
76			{
77				// line that might sit between doc comments
78				attrs.push(Attr::Verbatim {
79					line: self.lines.next().unwrap().unwrap()
80				});
81			} else {
82				// we've encountered the end of the doc comment
83				break;
84			}
85		}
86
87		let mut common_indent: Option<String> = None;
88		for attr in &attrs {
89			if let Attr::Doc {
90				comment_indent,
91				comment,
92				..
93			} = attr
94			{
95				match &common_indent {
96					Some(common)
97						if !comment_indent.starts_with(common) && !comment.is_empty() =>
98					{
99						common_indent = Some(
100							common
101								.chars()
102								.zip(comment_indent.chars())
103								.take_while(|(lhs, rhs)| lhs == rhs)
104								.map(|(ch, _)| ch)
105								.collect()
106						);
107					},
108					None => {
109						common_indent = Some(
110							comment_indent
111								.chars()
112								.take_while(|ch| ch.is_whitespace())
113								.collect()
114						);
115					},
116					_ => {}
117				}
118			}
119		}
120		let common_indent_len = common_indent
121			.map(|common| common.as_bytes().len())
122			.unwrap_or(0);
123		debug!(
124			"Removing common indent of {common_indent_len} bytes from {} lines",
125			attrs.len()
126		);
127
128		for attr in attrs {
129			match attr {
130				Attr::Doc {
131					indent,
132					style,
133					comment_indent,
134					comment
135				} => {
136					self.buf.extend_from_slice(indent.as_bytes());
137					self.buf.extend_from_slice(style.as_bytes());
138					self.buf
139						.extend(comment_indent.bytes().skip(common_indent_len));
140					self.buf.extend_from_slice(comment.as_bytes());
141				},
142				Attr::Verbatim { line } => {
143					self.buf.extend_from_slice(line.as_bytes());
144				}
145			}
146			self.buf.push(b'\n');
147		}
148
149		// the next line should not be part of the doc comment
150		if let Some(line) = self.lines.next() {
151			self.buf.extend_from_slice(line?.as_bytes());
152			self.buf.push(b'\n');
153		}
154
155		Ok(())
156	}
157}
158
159impl<L> io::Read for Preprocessor<L>
160where
161	L: Iterator<Item = io::Result<String>>
162{
163	fn read(&mut self, buf: &mut [u8]) -> io::Result<usize> {
164		if self.buf.is_empty() {
165			self.fill_buf()?;
166		}
167
168		let bytes = buf.len().min(self.buf.len());
169		let (head, tail) = self.buf.split_at(bytes);
170		buf[0 .. bytes].clone_from_slice(head);
171		self.buf = tail.to_owned();
172		Ok(bytes)
173	}
174}
